Title: 14.1 Built-In Function and Operator Reference
Description: Multiplication:

The last expression produces an error because the result of
            the integer multiplication exceeds the 64-bit range of
            BIGINT calculations. (See
            Section 13.1, “Numeric Data Types”.)

Title: 14.1 Built-In Function and Operator Reference
Description: Addition:

Press CTRL+C to copy mysql> SELECT 3+5;
        -> 8

Title: 14.1 Built-In Function and Operator Reference
Description: Subtraction:

Press CTRL+C to copy mysql> SELECT 3-5;
        -> -2

Title: 14.1 Built-In Function and Operator Reference
Description: Unary minus. This operator changes the sign of the operand.

Press CTRL+C to copy mysql> SELECT - 2;
        -> -2

Note


              If this operator is used with a
              BIGINT, the return value is
              also a BIGINT. This means
              that you should avoid using - on
              integers that may have the value of
              −263.

Title: 14.1 Built-In Function and Operator Reference
Description: Division:

Press CTRL+C to copy mysql> SELECT 3/5;
        -> 0.60
Division by zero produces a NULL result:

Press CTRL+C to copy mysql> SELECT 102/(1-1);
        -> NULL

A division is calculated with
            BIGINT arithmetic only if
            performed in a context where its result is converted to an
            integer.

Title: 14.1 Built-In Function and Operator Reference
Name: DIV
Description: DIV

Integer division. Discards from the division result any
            fractional part to the right of the decimal point.

If either operand has a noninteger type, the operands are
            converted to DECIMAL and
            divided using DECIMAL
            arithmetic before converting the result to
            BIGINT. If the result exceeds
            BIGINT range, an error occurs.

Press CTRL+C to copy mysql> SELECT 5 DIV 2, -5 DIV 2, 5 DIV -2, -5 DIV -2;
        -> 2, -2, -2, 2
Examples:
mysql> SELECT 5 DIV 2, -5 DIV 2, 5 DIV -2, -5 DIV -2;
        -> 2, -2, -2, 2

Title: 14.1 Built-In Function and Operator Reference
Name: %, MOD
Description:
N
            % M,
            N
            MOD M

            Modulo operation. Returns the remainder of
            N divided by
            M. For more information, see the
            description for the MOD()
            function in Section 14.6.2, “Mathematical Functions”.
